title: Onsite AI Chemistry Specialist (Master's Degree or Higher Required)

description:
Dive into the forefront of artificial intelligence and chemistry innovation with us! We're on the lookout for driven and knowledgeable AI Chemistry Specialists to join our team. This role offers the extraordinary opportunity to play a pivotal part in training generative AI models for a deeper understanding and better response to chemistry topics.

CORE ATTRIBUTES

What You Bring to The Table

Your role is essential in shaping the future of AI's capabilities in the realm of chemistry. With your expertise, you will guide AI models through complex chemical concepts, ensuring their outputs are both accurate and scientifically reliable. We are searching for individuals who exhibit:
• Scholarly Rigor – Your background in chemistry or a related discipline provides a solid foundation for training AI models with precision and depth.
• Keen Eye for Detail – Your meticulousness ensures the creation and evaluation of content that meets the highest standards of accuracy.
• Team Synergy – Your ability to collaborate effectively contributes to our mission, making significant strides in AI's understanding of chemistry.
• Creative Problem-Solving – You craft innovative prompts that challenge AI, pushing the boundaries of its problem-solving capabilities.
• Enthusiasm for AI and Chemistry – Your passion for bridging technology and science fuels continuous learning and innovation.

Responsibilities

Daily Expectations for Your Role

As an AI Chemistry Specialist, your contributions are crucial to our strategic vision. Your responsibilities include:
• Executing tasks and projects aimed at enhancing AI model proficiency in chemistry.
• Developing original and complex prompts to test and improve AI model responses.
• Analyzing and ranking AI-generated answers for scientific validity and relevance.
• Engaging in chemistry-specific projects to broaden and deepen AI's knowledge in the field.

Requirements

Qualifications for Success

Your expertise and qualifications are the bedrock of our collective progress in integrating AI with chemistry. We seek candidates with:
• A Master's degree or higher in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, or similar fields such as Molecular Biology, Forensic Science, Environmental Science, or Materials Engineering.
• An exceptional ability to identify and correct inaccuracies, maintaining a high standard of content quality.
• Proficient written and verbal communication skills in English.
• Based in or willing to relocate to Southlake, TX, with a readiness to work onsite 40 hours per week.

Preferred qualifications:
• Engaged in or completed a PhD program in a chemistry-focused discipline.
• Possession of teaching credentials or experience.
• A strong interest in AI and machine learning, especially as it relates to chemistry.
• Specialization in niche areas of chemistry.

About Our Client

Our client is a global leader in the field of artificial intelligence, committed to advancing the intersection of AI with various scientific disciplines, including chemistry. Their initiatives range from developing AI that can predict chemical reactions to creating models that understand the environmental impact of chemical compounds. This opportunity places you with an innovator in AI technology, whose work is not only advancing scientific knowledge but also applying it to solve real-world problems.

They offer:
• Competitive PTO accrual, with 96 hours per year.
• Pre-tax commuter benefits.
• Subsidized healthcare benefits, including a Flexible Spending Account for healthcare costs.
• Comprehensive coverage for disability and life insurance.
• An attractive 401k plan.

THE COMPANY

Our Commitment to You

Ami Arroyo Recruiting is more than just a recruiting firm; we're a partner in your career journey. We are dedicated to connecting exceptional talent with meaningful opportunities, supporting the

growth of careers and companies alike. We understand that everyone's path is unique, and we're committed to finding the perfect fit for each individual.

We embrace diversity and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to their status. While we are not able to sponsor visas at this time, we welcome every candidate eligible to work in the United States to connect with us.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• Commuter assistance
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 10 hour shift
• 8 hour shift
• Day shift

Education:
• Master's (Required)

Ability to Commute:
• Austin, TX (Required)

Work Location: In person
